1.text: And I say, so long time as the heir is a babe, he differeth nothing from a servant—being lord of all,

2.text: but is under tutors and stewards till the time appointed of the father,

3.text: so also we, when we were babes, under the elements of the world were in servitude,

4.text: and when the fulness of time did come, God sent forth His Son, come of a woman, come under law,

5.text: that those under law he may redeem, that the adoption of sons we may receive;

6.text: and because ye are sons, God did send forth the spirit of His Son into your hearts, crying, ‘Abba, Father!’

7.text: so that thou art no more a servant, but a son, and if a son, also an heir of God through Christ.

8.text: But then, indeed, not having known God, ye were in servitude to those not by nature gods,

9.text: and now, having known God—and rather being known by God—how turn ye again unto the weak and poor elements to which anew ye desire to be in servitude?

10.text: days ye observe, and months, and times, and years!

11.text: I am afraid of you, lest in vain I did labour toward you.

12.text: Become as I am—because I also am as ye brethren, I beseech you; to me ye did no hurt,

13.text: and ye have known that through infirmity of the flesh I did proclaim good news to you at the first,

14.text: and my trial that is in my flesh ye did not despise nor reject, but as a messenger of God ye did receive me—as Christ Jesus;

15.text: what then was your happiness? for I testify to you, that if possible, your eyes having plucked out, ye would have given to me;

16.text: so that your enemy have I become, being true to you?

17.text: they are zealous for you—yet not well, but they wish to shut us out, that for them ye may be zealous;

18.text: and it is good to be zealously regarded, in what is good, at all times, and not only in my being present with you;

19.text: my little children, of whom again I travail in birth, till Christ may be formed in you,

20.text: and I was wishing to be present with you now, and to change my voice, because I am in doubt about you.

21.text: Tell me, ye who are willing to be under law, the law do ye not hear?

22.text: for it hath been written, that Abraham had two sons, one by the maid-servant, and one by the free-woman,

23.text: but he who is of the maid-servant, according to flesh hath been, and he who is of the free-woman, through the promise;

24.text: which things are allegorized, for these are the two covenants: one, indeed, from mount Sinai, to servitude bringing forth, which is Hagar;

25.text: for this Hagar is mount Sinai in Arabia, and doth correspond to the Jerusalem that now is, and is in servitude with her children,

26.text: and the Jerusalem above is the free-woman, which is mother of us all,

27.text: for it hath been written, ‘Rejoice, O barren, who art not bearing; break forth and cry, thou who art not travailing, because many are the children of the desolate—more than of her having the husband.’

28.text: And we, brethren, as Isaac, are children of promise,

29.text: but as then he who was born according to the flesh did persecute him according to the spirit, so also now;

30.text: but what saith the Writing? ‘Cast forth the maid-servant and her son, for the son of the maid-servant may not be heir with the son of the free-woman;’

31.text: then, brethren, we are not a maid-servant’s children, but the free-woman’s.
